intro: Pimpinella refracta, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a slender and elongated shape. Pimpinella refracta is often found in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
